main event: A pilot observed a small, bright object passing overhead in Hempstead, New York on November 6, 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted about 10 minutes and the object traveled from south to north,The observer was under his own aircraft during the sighting,The object was described as giving the impression of being very small,The pilot was confident that it was not a conventional aircraft,The weather was clear and dark at the time of observation.
sighted object: a small, bright object appearing like a miniature aircraft
witness description: a pilot under his own aircraft
